newsitem.title: DENMARK: Tamil refugees stage hunger strikes in Denmark.
newsitem.headline: Tamil refugees stage hunger strikes in Denmark.

text.p: Ethnic Tamil refugees from Sri Lanka staging an open-ended hunger strike in protest at Denmark's expulsion of five of their compatriots threatened on Tuesday to refuse water.
They said they would stop drinking unless they received a satisfactory response from the authorities to their demand that no more of the approximately 400 Tamils in Denmark should be sent home.
"We will all stop taking water if we do not get an answer within the next two to three days," a Tamil hunger striker told Reuters by phone.
The Tamil hunger striker was one of more than over 100 asylum-seeking refugees in four camps in west Denmark staging the protest hunger strike.
He said one of the Tamils sent home by Denmark had been arrested in Sri Lanka and that they all feared the consequences of being repatriated.
The Sri Lankan government and Tamil separatists in the north of the island are locked in a bitter military confrontation in which thousands have died.
